issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: I was creating a new IAM user.  After typing in the user name 'testuser3', the 'Add User' button did not become enabled after I finished entering the name.  I also see other odd behavior with the button.  If you type in a user name, as you're typing, you can see the 'Add User' button become enabled/disabled as you are typing.  This seems to be more of a problem with Firefox than Chrome.  This isn't so bad with manual entry because you can manipulate the field until the button becomes enabled.  However, this is causing a problem with automation because you are not able to do this using selenium.  As a result, the test will always fail because it can never add a user.  I have attached a screen shot of the issue as it happened.
fields.summary: IAM Users Add User button stays disabled after typing in user name

comments.body: [~ccassler], can you add a 2 second sleep after entering the name? I see the button enabling after a short delay when pasting a string in the field.

[~dkavanagh], I tried that...in this case, it doesn't seem to matter how long you wait, the button never becomes enabled.  The only way for me to enable the button is to type in the field manually (ie, deleting and retyping a character) after the script runs.
[~dkavanagh], I was able to solve this problem using typeKeys.
Solved using typeKeys instead of type.
I'm reopening the bug because even though I was able to automate it, the problem with the button is still there.  There is a work around but it's still strange behavior.

investigating further, we have foundation's validation (abide) that checks for valid contents of the username field. There's a key listener with a delay that is causing this behavior. The listener delays to allow abide to set an error state (if necessary) then, we check the presence of that before setting the button state. Not sure there's a better way, but with enough time and money....
[~dkavanagh]: Might be worth investigating if we could use Angular's validation here instead.  See https://docs.angularjs.org/api/ng/directive/form
[~ccassler]: Should we escalate the priority of this ticket if it is blocking automated testing?

Still seeing the problem with [~kyolee]'s GUI-1046 branch. 

Could look at disabling Abide validation for that field, can still use the pattern but not use abide, according to team meeting. Validate on add button here.
[~kyolee]: Just a heads up that PR 776 has merge conflicts that need to be resolved
It would require another possible merge conflict resolution when GUI-1046 is merged. If no rush on this fix, I will take a look at this issue again when GUI-1046 is merged.

UX review for removing the flickering of the add user button is ready at:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/789

Do not merge this branch until GUI-1046 is resolved.
GUI-1046 has been merged. This branch is good to merge after the review.
looks good, no flickering. Merged feature branch to develop.
